page.title: 06A DAY AT PLYM BRIDGE
page.content: I get some of my friends at the weekend and I ask my mum to take me down to Plym Bridge and pick us up about 5:00pm.When we are down there we eat some dinner and walk up the river and try to catch some grass snakes or some fish.Once we caught a smooth snake.And sometimes we get to where you see old trains.The trains are old steam trains.Some people are painting them and making them better.They are making new tracks.They say they will try to make the track run up to Yelverton.They call it the Plym Valley Railway.Some times we walk from Glenholt Woods to Plym Bridge Wood.Twice I have seen deer.Once I saw a deer called the scotch white and an old man told me that you could find the deer's old antlers there.The first time I saw deer I thought they were wild dogs.
